main event: A radar object was detected over Cincinnati, Ohio in June 1944. The object was described as circular, larger than an aircraft, and emitting a reddish-orange glow. It was tracked on radar for 1 minute, moving in a circular pattern at approximately 600 mph before accelerating and going out of sight.
interesting points: The radar indicated the object was moving in a circular pattern, despite appearing to be hovering.
The object accelerated and went out of sight, as fading on the radar.
The report includes detailed questions and answer spaces for the witness to provide information about the sighting.
The report does not contain any photographs, only text-based details from the witness.
The report is from Project Blue Book, a historical U.S. Air Force program that investigated UFO sightings.
sighted object: circular object larger than an aircraft, emitting a reddish-orange glow
